column4: seriously? the linux support channel doesn't even know how to build an app launcher?
what are you talking about?
what is an app launcher?
different people know different things and everyone here is a volunteer.
I have used it for over a decade and I don't know how to launch a program they way you want to. Nor am I sure I know what you want.
you see the little buttons on your panel? they're called application launcher
system -> preferences -> main menu
and no, the actual entries are not called application launchers
however the main menu program allows you to edit the menus.
would you like a screenshot?
what? I just gave you the answer
and editing the menu requires the same command I don't know how to do
you need to make a script that does that. Or, you can cd /path; ./command
so the "command" box needs to say "cd /usr/local/games/nwn; ./nwn" yes?
I believe so. That is what I would try.
no such file or directory
ok, make a script and make the command the path to the script
how do I make a script?
you make a text file. You start the first line with #!/bin/bash
then you put one cmd on each line.
then you chmod 755 the_file.sh
it tells linux to use bash to run the commands.
